review_title: RN at RHC: Unsafe for patients and employees
pros: There are lots of friendly people who work here. Always lots of smiling faces, which is likely the only thing to get you through your miserable day.
cons:
Everything is about ratios and numbers, not about safety. The CCU will sometimes have 3:1 ratios and the pediatric unit is almost always only staffed with ONE person. The nursing supervisors have a complete disregard for safety, and will argue that a second person isn't needed to staff a unit. Depending on which supervisor is working, you may even get yelled at for calling them with a concern! Nurses are floated from unit to unit without proper training and again, with total disregard for patient safety. There is no continuity of care, as a nurse may be floated to three units in one shift. If you are unlucky enough to work on a unit such as pediatrics, where you will be alone for 12 hours, there is no one around. So, you will not be relieved for a break, not even to go to the bathroom. You will also not know who is coming or going from your unit as it is unlocked and isolated, putting you and your patients at risk. Your opinions will also go unheard in this hospital, so I do not recommend working here.
Advice to Management
Hire more staff. Staff your units (pediatrics!) with 2+ people. You can not have a unit open and run safely with one person. Teach your nursing supervisors this and teach them to treat their coworkers with basic human decency. Staffing a hospital full of travel nurses is not how to staff a hospital!!!!
